oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Memphis Appeal on potential library
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: crime; libraries; Memphis Appeal; newspapers; 1850s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1857 clippings from the Memphis Appeal newspaper. Brief entries in the "Town Facts and Fancies" section cover a variety of events and topics: the capture of an accused murderer, thoughts on a public library, a 300-pound green turtle, Mississippi River levels, the organization of a public Library Association, notes from police court, ward boundaries, and more. Note: Two clippings mounted.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: newspaper clipping reproduced from microfilm, black & white, mounted, 7 x 10.5 in.
